definition-item.definition-title: SPECIFIC USE OF COSMETICS OR SIMILAR TOILETRY PREPARATIONS

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Cosmetic compositions having one or more ingredient(s) classified in A61K8/00, i.e. ingredients considered to belong to the core of the invention (*).
Only principal use(s) linked to the inventive effect (**). A patent document, i.e. claims, description and examples are pertinent to classify principal and eventually additional use(s) (**).) (**).

Cosmetics or similar toiletry preparations should be further classified in subclass A61K8/00, i.e. definition of chemical ingredients and physical form of the preparations which is defined as the core of the invention (*).
Uses concerning further soap bars or cleaning methods (washing or hard cleaning compositions) are classified in C11D.

Compositions which can be used in a therapeutic treatment should be further classified in A61P and also in A61K31/00 - A61K51/00 if they are defined by their ingredients or in A61K9/00 if they are defined by their physical form.
Use of a composition as food or dietary supplement is further classified in A23L.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Medicinal preparation characterised by physical form

section-body.paragraph-text: The last place rule is not applicable in this subclass.
This subclass is always combined with the subclass A61K8/00 and can be further classified in A61K2800/00 and/or A61Q.

table-column.paragraph-text: Properties of cosmetic compositions or active ingredients thereof or formulation aids used therein and process related aspects

section-body.paragraph-text: The Indexing symbols of this scheme are to be used mainly with classification A61K8/00 and A61Q and is considered to be obligatory supplementary classification of subject matter already classified in A61K8/00 and A61Q if applicable.

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions or compounds characterised by specific properties

section-body.paragraph-text: This subclass is considered as additional information (**), i.e. obligatory supplementary classification of subject matter already classified in A61K8/00 and A61Q if applicable. This subclass concerns cosmetic uses which are indicated as eventual application(s) for the composition, see Example II.
Example I: general cosmetic use.

Some patent documents are concerned with general formulation problems like viscosity or specific preparations (i.e. suspensions or gels), i.e. no specific cosmetic use is thus foreseen. In those cases, classification is made in A61Q19/00.
Example II: principal or additional use(s).
A skin moisturising composition which is further used in a anti-ageing preparation or as lip cream, would be classified in A61Q19/00 and as additional information in A61Q19/08 or A61Q19/001.
A skin moisturising composition which is further used in an anti-ageing preparation or as lip cream, would be classified in A61Q19/00 and as additional information in A61Q19/08 or A61Q19/001.
If the active is a new sunscreen and an anti-ageing preparation which contains this new compound is exemplified, it should be classified in A61Q17/04 and as additional information in A61Q19/08.

If the active is a compound to condition the hair and a shampoo or a colouring composition (non-permanent hair dyeing containing direct dyes) is exemplified, it should be classified in A61Q5/12 and as additional information A61Q5/02 and A61Q5/065.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compounds in the composition or specific form (example: emulsion, foam) linked to the effect aimed. This means that not all compounds present in a composition are classified. To classify a document, the claims, the description and the examples have to be checked. Only specific components, i.e. those present in the exemplified compositions, are classified not a general concept or a general formula.

The principal use is linked to the effect intended in the document and is classified in A61Q. In the claims or examples further uses or types of compositions are often described which should be classified in A61Q. For example: a mixture of compounds is directed to an anti-aging purpose (A61Q19/08) which is further introduced in sunscreen composition (A61Q17/04).

definition-item.definition-title: Make-up preparations; Body powders; Preparations for removing make-up

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations which are intended to be topically applied to adorn, groom, absorb or to remove unwanted skin preparations.

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations containing skin colorants, e.g. pigments (preparations in powder form A61Q1/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Foundation ("fond de teint") .
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: for lips

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Lips gloss.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preparations for the lips, e.g. lip gloss

definition-item.definition-title: for cheeks, e.g. rouge

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations for the cheeks, e.g. blush.

definition-item.definition-title: for eyes, e.g. eyeliner, mascara

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations for eye lashes, eye brows or eye shadows.

definition-item.definition-title: Face or body powders for grooming, adorning or absorbing

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Foundations powders; Compact powders.

definition-item.definition-title: Manicure or pedicure preparations

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations which are topically applied to artificial or natural nails of the hands or feet for adorning, treating, fortifying, removing nail cuticles, or removing unwanted nail preparations.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Artificial nails are classified in per se

section-body.paragraph-text: Compositions for the in situ formation of artificial nails should be classified in A61K8/02 together with the appropriate Indexing Code under A61K2800/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Nail coatings

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Nail coatings, nail enamels, nail gloss.

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations for care of the hair

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations applied to the hair or scalp for for grooming, adorning, protecting, or otherwise treating.

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations for cleaning the hair

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations for cleansing the hair, e.g. shampoo.
Conditioning shampoos should be classified in A61Q5/02 and also in A61Q5/12.

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations for permanent waving or straightening the hair

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations for relaxing or curling the hair

definition-item.definition-title: {Preparations for temporary colouring the hair, e.g. direct dyes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations containing only direct dyes without the addition of any oxidation dye.

Hair dye compositions containing a direct dye and an oxidising agent, "lightening compositions" ("compositions éclaircissante") should be classified in A61Q5/065 together with the Indexing Code A61K2800/434.

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations for bleaching the hair

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations for removing dyes from the hair.

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations for permanently dyeing the hair

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Repigmentation of hair; Decorative depot; White hair dying ("Canitie").
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Hair dye compositions containing an oxidation dye and further a direct dye should be classified in A61Q5/10 .

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations containing hair conditioners

section-body.paragraph-text: Conditioning shampoos should be classified in A61Q5/12 and also in A61Q5/02.

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations for inhibiting or slowing hair growth

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations against hirsutism.

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations for removing hair or for aiding hair removal

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations which are applied topically to induce hair removal or to assist in the easier removal of hair.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Shaving preparations

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Pre-shaving preparations.

definition-item.definition-title: Depilatories

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Epilation and depilation preparations.

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations for care of the teeth, of the oral cavity or of dentures; Dentifrices, e.g. toothpastes; Mouth rinses

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations for maintaining hygiene of the mouth and teeth and for enhancing the appearance of the teeth, e.g. compositions for whitening or bleaching teeth.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dentistry, apparatus and method for oral or dental hygiene

definition-item.definition-title: Formulations or additives for perfume preparations (essential oils or perfumes per se C11B9/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations containing perfume and additives to improve the longevity or intensity or to stabilize a perfuming compound, e.g. aromatherapy.

definition-item.definition-title: Anti-perspirants or body deodorants (deodorisation of air A61L9/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Preparations which are topically applied to the body to inhibit or decrease perspiration or to neutralize, by other than a masking effect,, the odor caused by perspiration or to neutralize perspiration odor by action on a microorganism.

definition-item.definition-title: Barrier preparations; Preparations brought into direct contact with the skin for affording protection against external influences, e.g. sunlight, X-rays or other harmful rays, corrosive materials, bacteria or insect stings

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations which are topically applied to the skin to prevent or decrease the harmful effects of the environment, e.g. chemical irritants.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: For treating wounds, ulcers, burns, scars, keloids, or the like
Chemical means for combating harmful chemical agents

definition-item.definition-title: {Antimicrobial preparations}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations which are topically applied to the skin to eliminate or decrease the presence of microorganisms on the body, e.g. hand disinfection products.
Antimicrobial washing compositions should be classified in A61Q17/005 together with A61Q19/10.

definition-item.definition-title: containing insect repellants

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations which are topically applied to the skin to eliminate or repel the presence of insects on or around the body, e.g. anti-lice compositions.

definition-item.definition-title: Topical preparations for affording protection against sunlight or other radiation; Topical sun tanning preparations

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Compositions comprising ultraviolet filters for protection of skin and hair;
Protection against IR, X-Rays or other radiation.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preparations for treating ageing of skin and hair due to free radical action

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions for chemically tanning the skin e.g. containing dihydroxyacetone

section-body.paragraph-text: Preparations for treating skin and hair damage due to free radical action from external sources, e.g. sun damage, should be classified in A61Q17/04 together with the Indexing Code A61K2800/522

definition-item.definition-title: Preparations for care of the skin

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations for improving the barrier function; Preparations to treat wrinkles which have not been originated by aging, e.g. due to lack of sebum, e.g. moisturising.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preparations to treat wrinkles which have been originated by ageing

section-body.paragraph-text: Peeling and exfoliating compositions should be classified in A61Q19/00 together with the Indexing Code A61K2800/28.

definition-item.definition-title: {Preparations for care of the lips}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Compositions for care of the lips which comprise no skin colorant.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Aftersun preparations}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cosmetic post-treatment of sun damages.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Barrier preparations, e.g. for preventing or avoiding sun damages

definition-item.definition-title: {Preparations for sensitive skin}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Baby care products; Products for application around the eyes or in the genital area, e.g. compositions for treating "regions périnéofessières" e.g. compositions for treating perino anal regions and buttocks.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Medical preparations for treatment of the urogenital system

definition-item.definition-title: for chemically bleaching or whitening the skin

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Compositions against blotchiness or mottling; Preparations for treating age spots.
Tattoo removing compositions should be classified in
A61Q19/02 together with the appropriate Indexing Code under A61K2800/00.

definition-item.definition-title: for chemically tanning the skin (topical sun or radiation screening or tanning preparations A61Q17/04)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations for changing the skin colour.

definition-item.definition-title: for countering cellulitis

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparations for reducing the appearance of cellulite, i.e., dimpled fat deposits under the skin, e.g. slimming compositions.

definition-item.definition-title: Anti-ageing preparations

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preparation to treat wrinkles (all types of wrinkles); Preparations for treating skin and hair ageing due to free radical action.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Preparations for treating ageing of skin and hair due to free radical action should be classified in A61Q19/08 together with the Indexing Code A61K2800/522.

definition-item.definition-title: Washing or bathing preparations

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cleansing compositions; Scrubbing compositions e.g. exfoliation products.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Scrubbing compositions should be classified in A61Q19/00 .

definition-item.definition-title: Cosmetics or similar toiletry preparations for specific uses not provided for in other groups of this subclass

section-body.paragraph-text: No document should be classified in this subgroup.
